page.title: 05EDUCATION IN RHOOSE
page.content: There is one Primary School in Rhoose. The school is called {Rhws Primary.} This is the Welsh spelling of Rhoose and,as with most proper names in the area, it serves as a reminder that for most English place-names there is a Welsh origin. The school takes children from Reception to 11 years of age. The pupils then transfer to Secondary schools in Barry for the remainder of their compulsory education. There are approximately{270 children}at the school. With the increase in housing provision in the area it seems likely that the numbers in the school will grow in the near future. The main school building was built in the{1930's}and has recently undergone some major alterations. For instance, there was no indoor corridor to connect the classrooms.{(cont.)
